name: Salted Caramel Sauce
instructions: Cut butter into cubes and let sit at room temperature for 20–30 minutes.
Warm heavy cream gently until just warm to the touch (not hot).
Add sugar to a clean, dry saucepan. Heat over medium heat without stirring.
Once sugar starts melting at the edges, gently swirl the pan. Continue swirling until fully melted and golden amber in color.
Remove from heat and carefully add butter in small batches, whisking constantly.
Slowly pour in the warmed cream, whisking the whole time. It will bubble up.
If the caramel seizes or becomes lumpy, return to low heat and whisk until smooth.
Stir in sea salt and optional vanilla extract. Let cool 10–15 minutes before using.

storage_tips.room_temp: Cool completely before transferring to a jar. Use at room temperature for ice cream mix-ins.
storage_tips.refrigeration: Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Reheat gently if too firm before use.
